summary:
Namibia is a country in southern Africa with a long Atlantic Ocean coastline. It shares borders with Angola, Zambia, Botswana, and South Africa. The capital is Windhoek.

People have lived there since ancient times. Bantu people arrived around the 14th century, with the Ovambo being the largest group. Namibia was once a German colony and later under South African rule. It gained independence in 1990.

Namibia has a strong economy based on farming, tourism, and mining. However, it faces challenges with poverty and inequality. It is a member of the United Nations and the African Union.
title: Namibia
